intro: Pithecoctenium tribrachiatum, commonly known as the three-branched sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers with five lobed petals. The plant typically grows near coastal areas, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
